code_quality.justification: Excellent documentation with JSDoc comments on all public functions and types. Clear naming conventions (validateEmail, checkPasswordStrength, formatPhoneNumber). Comprehensive type definitions with discriminated unions for type-safe success/failure handling. Consistent code style throughout. The use of 'as const' for type inference and explicit return types demonstrates senior-level TypeScript patterns.

architecture.justification: Excellent separation of concerns: validators in separate files, utilities (patterns, constants, errors) properly isolated. Clean public API surface in index.ts with explicit re-exports. Discriminated union pattern enables type-safe error handling without exceptions. Zero runtime dependencies as designed. The structure follows the TRD specification precisely. Strong modularity allows tree-shaking and easy extension.

test_quality.justification: Comprehensive test coverage across 5 test files organized by functionality. Good use of describe blocks for logical grouping. Tests cover valid cases, invalid cases, edge cases, type exports, and security concerns (ReDoS, input length). Parametrized testing for special characters in password.test.ts. Tests use type narrowing with isValid discriminant demonstrating proper TypeScript patterns. Coverage thresholds enforced in jest.config.js at 60%.

error_handling.justification: Bulletproof input validation: MAX_INPUT_LENGTH check prevents DoS, empty/whitespace handling, RFC 5321 email length limit (254 chars). Specific error codes (EMAIL_EMPTY, EMAIL_INVALID_FORMAT, EMAIL_INVALID_DOMAIN, etc.) with human-readable messages. Discriminated union return types make error handling type-safe. Security-conscious design with linear-time regex patterns to prevent ReDoS. The createError helper provides consistent error creation.

summary: Senior-level TypeScript implementation with excellent architecture, comprehensive testing, and bulletproof error handling. The discriminated union pattern for validation results is elegant and type-safe. Security considerations (ReDoS prevention, input limits) are well-implemented. Documentation is comprehensive with JSDoc, README, PRD, and TRD. Minor areas for improvement: could add more extensive parametrized tests and property-based testing, but overall this is production-ready, well-designed code.
